00089 static int
00090 noteErr(const char *fmt, ...) {
00091     struct timeval t;
00092     va_list ap;
00093     struct ccn_charbuf *b = ccn_charbuf_create();
00094     ccn_charbuf_reserve(b, 1024);
00095     gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00096     ccn_charbuf_putf(b, "** ERROR: %s\n", fmt);
00097     char *fb = ccn_charbuf_as_string(b);
00098     va_start(ap, fmt);
00099     vfprintf(stderr, fb, ap);
00100     va_end(ap);
00101     fflush(stderr);
00102     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&b);
00103     return -1;
00104 }

00110 static int 
00111 parseAndAccumName(char *s, struct SyncNameAccum *na) {
00112     int i = 0;
00113     for (;;) {
00114         char c = s[i];
00115         int d = SyncDecodeUriChar(c);
00116         if (d <= 0) break;
00117         i++;
00118     }
00119     char save = s[i];
00120     s[i] = 0;
00121     struct ccn_charbuf *cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
00122     int skip = ccn_name_from_uri(cb, (const char *) s);
00123     s[i] = save;
00124     if (skip <= 0) {
00125         // not legal, so don't append the name
00126         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb);
00127         return skip;
00128     }
00129     // extract the size, which is the next numeric string
00130     // (no significant checking here)
00131     intmax_t size = 0;
00132     for (;;) {
00133         char c = s[i];
00134         if (c >= '0' && c <= '9') break;
00135         if (c < ' ') break;
00136         i++;
00137     }
00138     for (;;) {
00139         char c = s[i];
00140         if (c < '0' || c > '9') break;
00141         size = size * 10 + SyncDecodeHexDigit(c);
00142         i++;
00143     }
00144     // finally, append the name in the order it arrived
00145     SyncNameAccumAppend(na, cb, size);
00146     return skip;    
00147 }
00148 
00149 static struct SyncNameAccum *
00150 readAndAccumNames(FILE *input, int rem) {
00151     struct SyncNameAccum *na = SyncAllocNameAccum(4);
00152     static int tempLim = 4*1024;
00153     char *temp = NEW_ANY(tempLim+4, char);
00154     while (rem > 0) {
00155         // first, read a line
00156         int len = 0;
00157         while (len < tempLim) {
00158             int c = fgetc(input);
00159             if (c < 0 || c == '\n') break;
00160             temp[len] = c;
00161             len++;
00162         }
00163         temp[len] = 0;
00164         if (len == 0)
00165         // blank line stops us
00166         break;
00167         // now grab the name we found
00168         int pos = 0;
00169         static char *key = "ccnx:";
00170         int keyLen = strlen(key);
00171         int found = 0;
00172         while (pos < len) {
00173             if (strncasecmp(temp+pos, key, keyLen) == 0) {
00174                 // found the name start
00175                 parseAndAccumName(temp+pos, na);
00176                 found++;
00177                 break;
00178             }
00179             pos++;
00180         }
00181         if (found == 0) {
00182             // did not get "ccnx:" so try for "/" start
00183             for (pos = 0; pos < len; pos++) {
00184                 if (temp[pos]== '/') {
00185                     parseAndAccumName(temp+pos, na);
00186                     break;
00187                 }
00188             }
00189         }
00190         rem--;
00191     }
00192     free(temp);
00193     return na;
00194 }

00196 ////////////////////////////////////////

00200 static void
00201 printTreeInner(struct SyncTreeWorkerHead *head,
00202                struct ccn_charbuf *tmpB,
00203                struct ccn_charbuf *tmpD,
00204                FILE *f) {
00205     int i = 0;
00206     struct SyncTreeWorkerEntry *ent = SyncTreeWorkerTop(head);
00207     struct SyncHashCacheEntry *ce = ent->cacheEntry;
00208     if (ce == NULL) {
00209         fprintf(f, "?? no cacheEntry ??\n");
00210         return;
00211     }
00212     struct SyncNodeComposite *nc = ce->ncL;
00213     if (nc == NULL) nc = ce->ncR;
00214     if (nc == NULL) {
00215         fprintf(f, "?? no cacheEntry->nc ??\n");
00216         return;
00217     }
00218     for (i = 1; i < head->level; i++) fprintf(f, "  | ");
00219     char *hex = SyncHexStr(nc->hash->buf, nc->hash->length);
00220     fprintf(f, "node, depth = %d, refs = %d, leaves = %d, hash = %s\n",
00221             (int) nc->treeDepth, (int) nc->refLen, (int) nc->leafCount, hex);
00222     free(hex);
00223     ssize_t pos = 0;
00224     while (pos < nc->refLen) {
00225         struct SyncNodeElem *ep = &nc->refs[pos];
00226         ent->pos = pos;
00227         if (ep->kind & SyncElemKind_leaf) {
00228             // a leaf, so the element name is inline
00229             struct ccn_buf_decoder nameDec;
00230             struct ccn_buf_decoder *nameD = NULL;
00231             nameD = SyncInitDecoderFromOffset(&nameDec, nc, ep->start, ep->stop);
00232             ccn_charbuf_reset(tmpB);
00233             ccn_charbuf_reset(tmpD);
00234             SyncAppendElementInner(tmpB, nameD);
00235             ccn_uri_append(tmpD, tmpB->buf, tmpB->length, 1);
00236             for (i = 0; i < head->level; i++) fprintf(f, "  | ");
00237             fprintf(f, "%s\n", ccn_charbuf_as_string(tmpD));
00238         } else {
00239             // a node, so try this recursively
00240             SyncTreeWorkerPush(head);
00241             printTreeInner(head, tmpB, tmpD, f);
00242             SyncTreeWorkerPop(head);
00243         }
00244         pos++;
00245     }
00246 }
00247 
00248 static void
00249 printTree(struct SyncTreeWorkerHead *head, FILE *f) {
00250     struct ccn_charbuf *tmpB = ccn_charbuf_create();
00251     struct ccn_charbuf *tmpD = ccn_charbuf_create();
00252     printTreeInner(head, tmpB, tmpD, f);
00253     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&tmpB);
00254     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&tmpD);
00255 }
00256 
00257 static void putMark(FILE *f) {
00258     struct timeval mark;
00259     gettimeofday(&mark, 0);
00260     fprintf(f, "%ju.%06u: ",
00261             (uintmax_t) mark.tv_sec,
00262             (unsigned) mark.tv_usec);
00263 }

00269 // generate the encoding of a test object 
00270 static struct SyncNodeComposite *
00271 testGenComposite(struct SyncBaseStruct *base, int nRefs) {
00272     int res = 0;
00273     struct SyncNodeComposite *nc = SyncAllocComposite(base);
00274     struct ccn_charbuf *tmp = ccn_charbuf_create();
00275     
00276     // append the references
00277     while (nRefs > 0 && res == 0) {
00278         ccn_charbuf_reset(tmp);
00279         res |= SyncAppendRandomName(tmp, 5, 12);
00280         SyncNodeAddName(nc, tmp);
00281         nRefs--;
00282     }
00283     
00284     SyncEndComposite(nc); // appends finals counts
00285     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&tmp);
00286     
00287     nc->err = res;
00288     return nc;
00289 }

00291 static int
00292 testEncodeDecode(struct SyncTestParms *parms) {
00293     struct SyncBaseStruct *base = parms->base;
00294     struct ccn_charbuf *cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
00295     cb->length = 0;
00296     ccnb_element_begin(cb, CCN_DTAG_Content); // artificial!  only for testing!
00297     fwrite(cb->buf, sizeof(unsigned char), cb->length, stdout);
00298     
00299     struct SyncNodeComposite *nc = testGenComposite(base, 4);
00300     
00301     SyncWriteComposite(nc, stdout);
00302     
00303     struct ccn_buf_decoder ds;
00304     struct ccn_buf_decoder *d = SyncInitDecoderFromCharbuf(&ds, nc->cb, 0);
00305     struct SyncNodeComposite *chk = SyncAllocComposite(base);
00306     SyncParseComposite(chk, d);
00307     SyncWriteComposite(chk, stdout);
00308     SyncFreeComposite(chk);
00309     
00310     int pos = cb->length;
00311     ccnb_element_end(cb);  // CCN_DTAG_Content
00312     fwrite(cb->buf+pos, sizeof(unsigned char), cb->length-pos, stdout);
00313     fflush(stdout);
00314     
00315     SyncFreeComposite(nc);
00316     
00317     cb->length = 0;
00318     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb);
00319     
00320     return 0;
00321 }
00322 
00323 static int
00324 testReader(struct SyncTestParms *parms) {
00325     char *fn = parms->inputName;
00326     int sort = parms->sort;
00327     FILE *f = fopen(fn, "r");
00328     int res = 0;
00329     if (f != NULL) {
00330         int64_t startTime = SyncCurrentTime();
00331         struct SyncNameAccum *na = readAndAccumNames(f, MAX_READ_LEN);
00332         fclose(f);
00333         struct ccn_charbuf *tmp = ccn_charbuf_create();
00334         int i = 0;
00335         IndexSorter_Base ixBase = NULL;
00336         int accumNameBytes = 0;
00337         int accumContentBytes = 0;
00338         if (sort > 0) {
00339             IndexSorter_Index ixLim = na->len;
00340             ixBase = IndexSorter_New(ixLim, -1);
00341             ixBase->sorter = SyncNameAccumSorter;
00342             ixBase->client = na;
00343             IndexSorter_Index ix = 0;
00344             for (; ix < ixLim; ix++) IndexSorter_Add(ixBase, ix);
00345         }
00346         struct ccn_charbuf *lag = NULL;
00347         for (;i < na->len; i++) {
00348             int j = i;
00349             if (ixBase != NULL) j = IndexSorter_Rem(ixBase);
00350             struct ccn_charbuf *each = na->ents[j].name;
00351             if (sort == 1 && lag != NULL) {
00352                 int cmp = SyncCmpNames(each, lag);
00353                 if (cmp < 0)
00354                 return noteErr("bad sort (order)!");
00355                 if (cmp == 0)
00356                 return noteErr("bad sort (duplicate)!");
00357             }
00358             struct ccn_charbuf *repl = each;
00359             accumNameBytes = accumNameBytes + repl->length;
00360             ssize_t size = na->ents[j].data;
00361             accumContentBytes = accumContentBytes + size;
00362             ccn_charbuf_reset(tmp);
00363             ccn_uri_append(tmp, repl->buf, repl->length, 1);
00364             if (sort != 2) {
00365                 fprintf(stdout, "%4d", i);
00366                 if (sort) fprintf(stdout, ", %4d", j);
00367                 fprintf(stdout, ", %8zd, ", size);
00368             }
00369             fprintf(stdout, "%s\n", ccn_charbuf_as_string(tmp));
00370             lag = each;
00371             if (repl != each) ccn_charbuf_destroy(&repl);
00372         }
00373         int64_t dt = SyncDeltaTime(startTime, SyncCurrentTime());
00374         dt = (dt + 500)/ 1000;
00375         fprintf(stdout, "-- %d names, %d name bytes, %d content bytes, %d.%03d seconds\n",
00376                 na->len, accumNameBytes, accumContentBytes,
00377                 (int) (dt / 1000), (int) (dt % 1000));
00378         if (ixBase != NULL) IndexSorter_Free(&ixBase);
00379         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&tmp);
00380         na = SyncFreeNameAccum(na);
00381     } else {
00382         return noteErr("testReader, could not open %s", fn);
00383     }
00384     return res;
00385 }
00386 
00387 static int
00388 testReadBuilder(struct SyncTestParms *parms) {
00389     FILE *f = fopen(parms->inputName, "r");
00390     int ns = parms->nSplits;
00391     int res = 0;
00392     
00393     if (f != NULL) {
00394         struct SyncRootStruct *root = parms->root;
00395         
00396         if (root == NULL) {
00397             // need a new one
00398             struct ccn_charbuf *topo = ccn_charbuf_create();
00399             ccn_name_from_uri(topo, "/ccn/test/sync");
00400             
00401             struct ccn_charbuf *prefix = ccn_charbuf_create();
00402             ccn_name_from_uri(prefix, "/ccn/test");
00403             
00404             root = SyncAddRoot(parms->base,
00405                                parms->syncScope,
00406                                topo,
00407                                prefix,
00408                                NULL);
00409             parms->root = root;
00410             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&topo);
00411             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&prefix);
00412         }
00413         
00414         if (root->namesToAdd != NULL)
00415         SyncFreeNameAccum(root->namesToAdd);
00416         
00417         struct SyncLongHashStruct longHash;
00418         int split = 0;
00419         memset(&longHash, 0, sizeof(longHash));
00420         longHash.pos = MAX_HASH_BYTES;
00421         for (;;) {
00422             int i = 0;
00423             if (ns == 0) {
00424                 root->namesToAdd = readAndAccumNames(f, MAX_READ_LEN);
00425             } else {
00426                 int p = 0;
00427                 int k = parms->splits[split];
00428                 if (split > 0) p = parms->splits[split-1];
00429                 if (k <= 0 || k >= ns) {
00430                     return noteErr("splits: bad k %d", k);
00431                     break;
00432                 }
00433                 if (p < 0 || p >= k) {
00434                     return noteErr("splits: bad p %d", k);
00435                     break;
00436                 }
00437                 root->namesToAdd = readAndAccumNames(f, k-p);
00438             }
00439             
00440             if (root->namesToAdd == NULL || root->namesToAdd->len <= 0)
00441             // the data ran out first
00442             break;
00443             
00444             for (i = 0; i < root->namesToAdd->len; i++) {
00445                 SyncAccumHash(&longHash, root->namesToAdd->ents[i].name);
00446             }
00447             // TBD: fix this -- SyncUpdateRoot(root);
00448             
00449             struct ccn_charbuf *hb = SyncLongHashToBuf(&longHash);
00450             struct ccn_charbuf *rb = root->currentHash;
00451             if (rb->length != hb->length
00452                 || memcmp(rb->buf, hb->buf, hb->length) != 0) {
00453                 // this is not right!
00454                 char *hexL = SyncHexStr(hb->buf, hb->length);
00455                 char *hexR = SyncHexStr(rb->buf, rb->length);
00456                 res = noteErr("hexL %s, hexR %s", hexL, hexR);
00457                 free(hexL);
00458                 free(hexR);
00459                 return res;
00460             }
00461             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&hb);
00462             
00463             struct SyncHashCacheEntry *ce = SyncRootTopEntry(root);
00464             struct SyncTreeWorkerHead *tw = SyncTreeWorkerCreate(root->ch, ce);
00465             switch (parms->mode) {
00466                 case 0: {
00467                     // no output
00468                     break;
00469                 }
00470                 case 1: {
00471                     // binary output
00472                     SyncWriteComposite(ce->ncL, stdout);
00473                     break;
00474                 }
00475                 case 2: {
00476                     // text output
00477                     SyncTreeWorkerInit(tw, ce);
00478                     printTree(tw, stdout);
00479                     fprintf(stdout, "-----------------------\n");
00480                     break;
00481                 }
00482                 default: {
00483                     // no output
00484                     break;
00485                 }
00486             }
00487             
00488             // release intermediate resources
00489             tw = SyncTreeWorkerFree(tw);
00490             split++;
00491             if (ns > 0 && split >= ns) break;
00492         }
00493         
00494         fclose(f);
00495         return 0;
00496         
00497     } else {
00498         return noteErr("testReadBuilder, could not open %s", parms->inputName);
00499     }
00500 }

00502 // generate a simple canned root for routing
00503 // based on anticipated root for the routing info
00504 static struct SyncRootStruct *
00505 genTestRootRouting(struct SyncTestParms *parms) {
00506     struct SyncBaseStruct *base = parms->base;
00507     struct ccn_charbuf *topoPrefix = ccn_charbuf_create();
00508     struct ccn_charbuf *namingPrefix = ccn_charbuf_create();
00509     
00510     ccn_name_from_uri(topoPrefix, "/ccn/test/sync");
00511     ccn_name_from_uri(namingPrefix, "/ccn/test/routing");
00512     struct SyncRootStruct *root = SyncAddRoot(base,
00513                                               parms->syncScope,
00514                                               topoPrefix,
00515                                               namingPrefix,
00516                                               NULL);
00517     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&topoPrefix);
00518     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&namingPrefix);
00519     return root;
00520 }

00522 // generate a simple canned root for repos
00523 // based on anticipated root for the routing info
00524 static struct SyncRootStruct *
00525 genTestRootRepos(struct SyncTestParms *parms) {
00526     struct SyncBaseStruct *base = parms->base;
00527     struct ccn_charbuf *topoPrefix = ccn_charbuf_create();
00528     struct ccn_charbuf *namingPrefix = ccn_charbuf_create();
00529     
00530     ccn_name_from_uri(topoPrefix, "/ccn/test/sync");
00531     ccn_name_from_uri(namingPrefix, "/ccn/test/repos");
00532     
00533     struct SyncNameAccum *filter = SyncAllocNameAccum(4);
00534     struct ccn_charbuf *clause = ccn_charbuf_create();
00535     ccn_name_from_uri(clause, "/PARC");
00536     SyncNameAccumAppend(filter, clause, 0);
00537     
00538     struct SyncRootStruct *root = SyncAddRoot(base,
00539                                               parms->syncScope,
00540                                               topoPrefix,
00541                                               namingPrefix,
00542                                               filter);
00543     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&topoPrefix);
00544     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&namingPrefix);
00545     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&clause);
00546     SyncFreeNameAccum(filter);
00547     
00548     return root;
00549 }

00551 static struct SyncRootStruct *
00552 testRootCoding(struct SyncTestParms *parms, struct SyncRootStruct *root) {
00553     struct SyncBaseStruct *base = parms->base;
00554     struct ccn_charbuf *cb1 = ccn_charbuf_create();
00555     int res = 0;
00556     SyncRootAppendSlice(cb1, root);  // generate the encoding
00557     
00558     SyncRemRoot(root);  // smoke test the removal
00559     
00560     struct ccn_buf_decoder ds;
00561     struct ccn_buf_decoder *d = SyncInitDecoderFromCharbuf(&ds, cb1, 0);
00562     root = SyncRootDecodeAndAdd(base, d);
00563     if (root == NULL) {
00564         res = noteErr("SyncRootDecodeAndAdd, failed");
00565     }
00566     if (res ==0) {
00567         // we have a root
00568         struct ccn_charbuf *cb2 = ccn_charbuf_create();
00569         SyncRootAppendSlice(cb2, root);
00570         
00571         if (res == 0) {
00572             // compare the encoding lengths
00573             if (cb1->length == 0 || cb1->length != cb2->length) {
00574                 res = noteErr("testRootCoding, bad encoding lengths, %d != %d",
00575                               (int) cb1->length, (int) cb2->length);
00576             }
00577         }
00578         if (res == 0) {
00579             // compare the encoding contents
00580             ssize_t cmp = memcmp(cb1->buf, cb2->buf, cb1->length);
00581             if (cmp != 0) {
00582                 res = noteErr("testRootCoding, bad encoding data",
00583                               (int) cb1->length, (int) cb2->length);
00584                 res = -1;
00585             }
00586         }
00587         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb2);
00588     }
00589     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb1);
00590     
00591     if (res == 0) return root;
00592     
00593     SyncRemRoot(root);
00594     return NULL;
00595     
00596 }
00597 
00598 static int
00599 testRootLookup (struct SyncTestParms *parms, struct SyncRootStruct *root,
00600                 char * goodName, char * badName) {
00601     int res = 0;
00602     // now try a few lookups
00603     struct ccn_charbuf *name = ccn_charbuf_create();
00604     ccn_name_from_uri(name, goodName);
00605     enum SyncRootLookupCode ec = SyncRootLookupName(root, name);
00606     if (ec != SyncRootLookupCode_covered) {
00607         res = noteErr("testRootLookup, good name not covered, %s",
00608                       goodName);
00609     }
00610     ccn_charbuf_reset(name);
00611     ccn_name_from_uri(name, badName);
00612     ec = SyncRootLookupName(root, name);
00613     if (ec != SyncRootLookupCode_none) {
00614         res = noteErr("testRootLookup, bad name not rejected, %s",
00615                       badName);
00616     }
00617     return res;
00618 }
00619 
00620 static int
00621 testRootBasic(struct SyncTestParms *parms) {
00622     int res = 0;
00623     struct SyncRootStruct *root = NULL;
00624     
00625     struct ccn_charbuf *cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
00626     uintmax_t val = 37;
00627     res |= SyncAppendTaggedNumber(cb, CCN_DTAG_SyncVersion, val);
00628     
00629     if (res == 0) {
00630         struct ccn_buf_decoder ds;
00631         struct ccn_buf_decoder *d = ccn_buf_decoder_start(&ds, cb->buf, cb->length);
00632         if (SyncParseUnsigned(d, CCN_DTAG_SyncVersion) != val
00633             || d->decoder.state < 0)
00634         res = -__LINE__;
00635     }
00636     
00637     if (res < 0) {
00638         return noteErr("testRootBasic, basic numbers failed, %d", res);
00639     }
00640     
00641     // test no filter
00642     root = genTestRootRouting(parms);
00643     root = testRootCoding(parms, root);
00644     res = testRootLookup(parms, root,
00645                          "ccnx:/ccn/test/routing/XXX",
00646                          "ccnx:/ccn/test/repos/PARC/XXX");
00647     SyncRemRoot(root);
00648     if (res < 0) return res;
00649     
00650     // test with filter
00651     root = genTestRootRepos(parms);
00652     root = testRootCoding(parms, root);
00653     res = testRootLookup(parms, root,
00654                          "ccnx:/ccn/test/repos/PARC/XXX",
00655                          "ccnx:/ccn/test/routing/XXX");
00656     SyncRemRoot(root);
00657     if (res < 0) {
00658         return noteErr("testRootBasic, failed");
00659     }
00660     
00661     return res;
00662 }
00663 
00664 static int
00665 localStore(struct SyncTestParms *parms,
00666            struct ccn *ccn, struct ccn_charbuf *nm, struct ccn_charbuf *cb) {
00667     int res = 0;
00668     struct ccn_charbuf *template = SyncGenInterest(NULL,
00669                                                    1,  // always local
00670                                                    parms->life,
00671                                                    -1, -1, NULL);
00672     struct ccn_charbuf *tmp = ccn_charbuf_create();
00673     ccn_create_version(ccn, nm, CCN_V_NOW, 0, 0);
00674     ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(tmp, nm);
00675     ccn_name_from_uri(tmp, "%C1.R.sw");
00676     ccn_name_append_nonce(tmp);
00677     ccn_get(ccn, tmp, NULL, DEFAULT_CMD_TIMEOUT, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0);
00678     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&tmp);
00679     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&template);
00680     if (res < 0) return res;
00681     
00682     struct ccn_charbuf *cob = ccn_charbuf_create();
00683     struct ccn_signing_params sp = CCN_SIGNING_PARAMS_INIT;
00684     const void *cp = NULL;
00685     size_t cs = 0;
00686     if (cb != NULL) {
00687         sp.type = CCN_CONTENT_DATA;
00688         cp = (const void *) cb->buf;
00689         cs = cb->length;
00690     } else {
00691         sp.type = CCN_CONTENT_GONE;
00692     }
00693     ccn_name_append_numeric(nm, CCN_MARKER_SEQNUM, 0);
00694     sp.sp_flags |= CCN_SP_FINAL_BLOCK;
00695     res |= ccn_sign_content(ccn,
00696                             cob,
00697                             nm,
00698                             &sp,
00699                             cp,
00700                             cs);
00701     res |= ccn_put(ccn, (const void *) cob->buf, cob->length);
00702     // ccn_run(ccn, 150);
00703     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cob);
00704     return res;
00705 }
00706 
00707 static int
00708 sendSlice(struct SyncTestParms *parms,
00709           char *topo, char *prefix,
00710           int count, char **clauses) {
00711     // constructs a simple config slice and sends it to an attached repo
00712     struct ccn_charbuf *cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
00713     struct ccn_charbuf *hash = ccn_charbuf_create();
00714     struct ccn_charbuf *nm = ccn_charbuf_create();
00715     int i = 0;
00716     int res = 0;
00717     res |= ccnb_element_begin(cb, CCN_DTAG_SyncConfigSlice);
00718     res |= SyncAppendTaggedNumber(cb, CCN_DTAG_SyncVersion, SLICE_VERSION);
00719     res |= ccn_name_from_uri(nm, topo);
00720     res |= ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(cb, nm);
00721     res |= ccn_name_from_uri(nm, prefix);
00722     res |= ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(cb, nm);
00723     res |= ccnb_element_begin(cb, CCN_DTAG_SyncConfigSliceList);
00724     for (i = 0; i < count ; i++) {
00725         res |= SyncAppendTaggedNumber(cb, CCN_DTAG_SyncConfigSliceOp, 0);
00726         res |= ccn_name_from_uri(nm, clauses[i]);
00727         res |= ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(cb, nm);
00728     }
00729     res |= ccnb_element_end(cb);
00730     res |= ccnb_element_end(cb);
00731     
00732     if (res >= 0) {
00733         // now we have the encoding, so make the hash
00734         struct ccn *ccn = NULL;
00735         struct ccn_digest *cow = ccn_digest_create(CCN_DIGEST_DEFAULT);
00736         size_t sz = ccn_digest_size(cow);
00737         unsigned char *dst = ccn_charbuf_reserve(hash, sz);
00738         ccn_digest_init(cow);
00739         ccn_digest_update(cow, cb->buf, cb->length);
00740         ccn_digest_final(cow, dst, sz);
00741         hash->length = sz;
00742         ccn_digest_destroy(&cow);
00743         
00744         // form the Sync protocol name
00745         static char *localLit = "\xC1.M.S.localhost";
00746         static char *sliceCmd = "\xC1.S.cs";
00747         res |= ccn_name_init(nm);
00748         res |= ccn_name_append_str(nm, localLit);
00749         res |= ccn_name_append_str(nm, sliceCmd);
00750         res |= ccn_name_append(nm, hash->buf, hash->length);
00751         
00752         if (parms->noSend) {
00753             // don't send the slice, just print the hash as a URI
00754             struct ccn_charbuf *hName = ccn_charbuf_create();
00755             ccn_name_init(hName);
00756             ccn_name_append(hName, hash->buf, hash->length);
00757             struct ccn_charbuf *uri = SyncUriForName(hName);
00758             fprintf(stdout, "%s\n", ccn_charbuf_as_string(uri));
00759             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&hName);
00760             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&uri);
00761             return 0;
00762         }
00763         
00764         ccn = ccn_create();
00765         if (ccn_connect(ccn, NULL) == -1) {
00766             perror("Could not connect to ccnd");
00767             exit(1);
00768         }
00769         if (res >= 0) res |= localStore(parms, ccn, nm, cb);
00770         if (res < 0) {
00771             res = noteErr("sendSlice, failed");
00772         } else {
00773             if (parms->mode != 0) {
00774                 struct ccn_charbuf *uri = SyncUriForName(nm);
00775                 if (parms->mark) putMark(stdout);
00776                 fprintf(stdout, "sendSlice, sent %s\n",
00777                         ccn_charbuf_as_string(uri));
00778                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&uri);
00779             }
00780         }
00781         
00782         ccn_destroy(&ccn);
00783     }
00784     
00785     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb);
00786     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&hash);
00787     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&nm);
00788     if (res > 0) res = 0;
00789     return res;
00790 }
00791 
00792 struct storeFileStruct {
00793     struct SyncTestParms *parms;
00794     struct ccn_charbuf *nm;
00795     struct ccn_charbuf *cb;
00796     struct ccn *ccn;
00797     off_t bs;
00798     off_t fSize;
00799     FILE *file;
00800     unsigned char *segData;
00801     int nSegs;
00802     int stored;
00803     struct ccn_charbuf *template;
00804 };
00805 
00806 static int64_t
00807 segFromInfo(struct ccn_upcall_info *info) {
00808         // gets the current segment number for the info
00809         // returns -1 if not known
00810         if (info == NULL) return -1;
00811         const unsigned char *ccnb = info->content_ccnb;
00812         struct ccn_indexbuf *cc = info->content_comps;
00813         if (cc == NULL || ccnb == NULL) {
00814                 // go back to the interest
00815                 cc = info->interest_comps;
00816                 ccnb = info->interest_ccnb;
00817                 if (cc == NULL || ccnb == NULL) return -1;
00818         }
00819         int ns = cc->n;
00820         if (ns > 2) {
00821                 // assume that the segment number is the last component
00822                 int start = cc->buf[ns - 2];
00823                 int stop = cc->buf[ns - 1];
00824                 if (start < stop) {
00825                         size_t len = 0;
00826                         const unsigned char *data = NULL;
00827                         ccn_ref_tagged_BLOB(CCN_DTAG_Component, ccnb, start, stop, &data, &len);
00828                         if (len > 0 && data != NULL) {
00829                                 // parse big-endian encoded number
00830                                 // TBD: where is this in the library?
00831                                 if (data[0] == CCN_MARKER_SEQNUM) {
00832                     int64_t n = 0;
00833                     int i = 0;
00834                     for (i = 1; i < len; i++) {
00835                         n = n * 256 + data[i];
00836                     }
00837                     return n;
00838                 }
00839                         }
00840                 }
00841         }
00842         return -1;
00843 }
00844 
00845 static enum ccn_upcall_res
00846 storeHandler(struct ccn_closure *selfp,
00847              enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
00848              struct ccn_upcall_info *info) {
00849     struct storeFileStruct *sfd = selfp->data;
00850     enum ccn_upcall_res ret = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK;
00851     switch (kind) {
00852         case CCN_UPCALL_FINAL:
00853         free(selfp);
00854         break;
00855         case CCN_UPCALL_INTEREST: {
00856             int64_t seg = segFromInfo(info);
00857             if (seg < 0) seg = 0;
00858             struct ccn_charbuf *uri = ccn_charbuf_create();
00859             ccn_uri_append(uri, sfd->nm->buf, sfd->nm->length, 0);
00860             char *str = ccn_charbuf_as_string(uri);
00861             ret = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_INTEREST_CONSUMED;
00862             if (seg >= 0 && seg < sfd->nSegs) {
00863                 struct ccn_charbuf *name = SyncCopyName(sfd->nm);
00864                 struct ccn_charbuf *cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
00865                 struct ccn_charbuf *cob = ccn_charbuf_create();
00866                 off_t bs = sfd->bs;
00867                 off_t pos = seg * bs;
00868                 off_t rs = sfd->fSize - pos;
00869                 if (rs > bs) rs = bs;
00870                 
00871                 ccn_charbuf_reserve(cb, rs);
00872                 cb->length = rs;
00873                 char *cp = ccn_charbuf_as_string(cb);
00874                 
00875                 // fill in the contents
00876                 int res = fseeko(sfd->file, pos, SEEK_SET);
00877                 if (res >= 0) {
00878                     res = fread(cp, rs, 1, sfd->file);
00879                     if (res < 0) {
00880                         char *eMess = strerror(errno);
00881                         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR in fread, %s, seg %d, %s\n",
00882                                 eMess, (int) seg, str);
00883                     }
00884                 } else {
00885                     char *eMess = strerror(errno);
00886                     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR in fseeko, %s, seg %d, %s\n",
00887                             eMess, (int) seg, str);
00888                 }
00889                 
00890                 if (res >= 0) {
00891                     struct ccn_signing_params sp = CCN_SIGNING_PARAMS_INIT;
00892                     const void *cp = NULL;
00893                     sp.type = CCN_CONTENT_DATA;
00894                     cp = (const void *) cb->buf;
00895                     sp.template_ccnb = sfd->template;
00896                     
00897                     if (seg+1 == sfd->nSegs) sp.sp_flags |= CCN_SP_FINAL_BLOCK;
00898                     ccn_name_append_numeric(name, CCN_MARKER_SEQNUM, seg);
00899                     res |= ccn_sign_content(sfd->ccn,
00900                                             cob,
00901                                             name,
00902                                             &sp,
00903                                             cp,
00904                                             rs);
00905                     if (sfd->parms->digest) {
00906                         // not sure if this generates the right hash
00907                         struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject pcos;
00908                         ccn_parse_ContentObject(cob->buf, cob->length,
00909                                                 &pcos, NULL);
00910                         ccn_digest_ContentObject(cob->buf, &pcos);
00911                         if (pcos.digest_bytes > 0)
00912                             res |= ccn_name_append(name, pcos.digest, pcos.digest_bytes);
00913                     }
00914                     res |= ccn_put(sfd->ccn, (const void *) cob->buf, cob->length);
00915                     
00916                     if (res < 0) {
00917                         return noteErr("seg %d, %s",
00918                                        (int) seg,
00919                                        str);
00920                     } else if (sfd->parms->verbose) {
00921                         if (sfd->parms->mark) putMark(stdout);
00922                         struct ccn_charbuf *nameUri = ccn_charbuf_create();
00923                         ccn_uri_append(nameUri, name->buf, name->length, 0);
00924                         char *nameStr = ccn_charbuf_as_string(nameUri);
00925                         fprintf(stdout, "put seg %d, %s\n",
00926                                 (int) seg,
00927                                 nameStr);
00928                         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&nameUri);
00929                     }
00930                     
00931                     // update the tracking
00932                     unsigned char uc = sfd->segData[seg];
00933                     if (uc == 0) {
00934                         uc++;
00935                         sfd->stored++;
00936                     } else {
00937                         if (sfd->parms->noDup) {
00938                             fprintf(stderr,
00939                                     "ERROR in storeHandler, duplicate segment request, seg %d, %s\n",
00940                                     (int) seg, str);
00941                         }
00942                         if (uc < 255) uc++;
00943                     }
00944                     sfd->segData[seg] = uc;
00945                 }
00946                 
00947                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
00948                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb);
00949                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cob);
00950                 
00951             }
00952             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&uri);
00953             break;
00954         }
00955         default:
00956         ret = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR;
00957         break;
00958     }
00959     return ret;
00960 }
00961 
00962 static void
00963 formatStats(struct SyncTestParms *parms) {
00964     int64_t dt = (1000000*(parms->stopTime.tv_sec-parms->startTime.tv_sec)
00965                   + parms->stopTime.tv_usec-parms->startTime.tv_usec);
00966     if (dt <= 0) dt = 1;
00967     int64_t rate = 0;
00968     
00969     switch (parms->mode) {
00970         case 0: {
00971             // silent
00972             break;
00973         }
00974         case 3: {
00975             // catchunks2 compatible
00976             const char *expid = getenv("CCN_EXPERIMENT_ID");
00977             const char *sep = " ";
00978             if (expid == NULL) {
00979                 expid = "";
00980                 sep = "";
00981             }
00982             rate = (parms->fSize * 1000000) / dt;
00983             if (parms->mark) putMark(stderr);
00984             fprintf(stderr,
00985                     "%ld.%06u SyncTest[%d]: %s%s"
00986                     "%jd bytes transferred in %ld.%06u seconds (%ld bytes/sec)"
00987                     "\n",
00988                     (long) parms->stopTime.tv_sec,
00989                     (unsigned) parms->stopTime.tv_usec,
00990                     (int)getpid(),
00991                     expid,
00992                     sep,
00993                     (intmax_t) parms->fSize,
00994                     (long) (dt / 1000000),
00995                     (unsigned) (dt % 1000000),
00996                     (long) rate
00997                     );
00998             break;
00999         }
01000         default: {
01001             // brief mode
01002             dt = (dt + 500) / 1000;
01003             if (dt <= 0) dt = 1;
01004             rate = parms->fSize / dt;
01005             
01006             if (parms->mark) putMark(stdout);
01007             fprintf(stdout, "transferred %jd bytes in %d.%03d seconds = %d.%03d MB/sec\n",
01008                     (intmax_t) parms->fSize,
01009                     (int) (dt / 1000), (int) dt % 1000,
01010                     (int) (rate / 1000), (int) rate % 1000);
01011             break;
01012         }
01013         
01014     }
01015 }
01016 
01017 static int
01018 getFile(struct SyncTestParms *parms, char *src, char *dst) {
01019     // gets the file, stores it to stdout
01020     
01021     FILE *file = NULL;
01022     
01023     if (dst != NULL) {
01024         file = fopen(dst, "w");
01025         if (file == NULL) {
01026             perror("fopen failed");
01027             return -1;
01028         }
01029     }
01030     
01031     struct ccn *ccn = NULL;
01032     ccn = ccn_create();
01033     // special case to remove verification overhead
01034     if (dst == NULL)
01035     ccn_defer_verification(ccn, 1);
01036     if (ccn_connect(ccn, NULL) == -1) {
01037         perror("Could not connect to ccnd");
01038         return -1;
01039     }
01040     struct ccn_charbuf *cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
01041     struct ccn_charbuf *nm = ccn_charbuf_create();
01042     int bs = parms->blockSize;
01043     
01044     int res = ccn_name_from_uri(nm, src);
01045     if (res < 0) {
01046         perror("ccn_name_from_uri failed");
01047         return -1;
01048     }
01049     
01050     if (parms->resolve) {
01051         res = ccn_resolve_version(ccn, nm, CCN_V_HIGH, parms->life*1000);
01052         // TBD: use parms to determine versioning_flags and timeout_ms?
01053         if (res < 0) {
01054             perror("ccn_resolve_version failed");
01055             return -1;
01056         }
01057     }
01058     
01059     struct ccn_fetch *cf = ccn_fetch_new(ccn);
01060     struct ccn_charbuf *template = SyncGenInterest(NULL,
01061                                                    parms->scope,
01062                                                    parms->life,
01063                                                    -1, -1, NULL);
01064     
01065     if (parms->verbose) {
01066         ccn_fetch_set_debug(cf, stderr,
01067                             ccn_fetch_flags_NoteOpenClose
01068                             | ccn_fetch_flags_NoteNeed
01069                             | ccn_fetch_flags_NoteFill
01070                             | ccn_fetch_flags_NoteTimeout
01071                             | ccn_fetch_flags_NoteFinal);
01072     }
01073     gettimeofday(&parms->startTime, 0);
01074     
01075     if (parms->segmented == 0) {
01076         // no segments, so use a single get
01077         struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject pcos;
01078         res = ccn_get(ccn, nm, template,
01079                       parms->life*1000,
01080                       cb, &pcos, NULL, 0);
01081         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&template);
01082         if (res < 0) {
01083             perror("get failed");
01084             return -1;
01085         }
01086         if (file != NULL) {
01087             size_t nItems = fwrite(ccn_charbuf_as_string(cb), cb->length, 1, file);
01088             if (nItems < 1) {
01089                 perror("fwrite failed");
01090                 return -1;
01091             }
01092         }
01093         parms->fSize = parms->fSize + cb->length;
01094         
01095     } else {
01096         // segmented, so use fetch.h
01097         struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs = ccn_fetch_open(cf, nm,
01098                                                      "SyncTest",
01099                                                      template,
01100                                                      parms->bufs,
01101                                                      0, 0);
01102         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&template);
01103         if (fs == NULL) {
01104             perror("ccn_fetch_open failed");
01105             return -1;
01106         }
01107         ccn_charbuf_reserve(cb, bs);
01108         cb->length = bs;
01109         char *cp = ccn_charbuf_as_string(cb);
01110         
01111         for (;;) {
01112             intmax_t av = ccn_fetch_avail(fs);
01113             if (av == CCN_FETCH_READ_NONE) {
01114                 res = ccn_run(ccn, 1);
01115                 if (res < 0) {
01116                     perror("ccn_run failed");
01117                     return -1;
01118                 }
01119                 continue;
01120             }
01121             int nb = ccn_fetch_read(fs, cp, bs);
01122             if (nb > 0) {
01123                 if (file != NULL) {
01124                     size_t nItems = fwrite(cp, nb, 1, file);
01125                     if (nItems < 1) {
01126                         perror("fwrite failed");
01127                         exit(1);
01128                     }
01129                 }
01130                 parms->fSize = parms->fSize + nb;
01131             } else if (nb == CCN_FETCH_READ_NONE) {
01132                 // try again
01133                 res = ccn_run(ccn, 1);
01134                 if (res < 0) {
01135                     perror("ccn_run failed");
01136                     return -1;
01137                 }                
01138             } else {
01139                 if (nb == CCN_FETCH_READ_END) break;
01140                 if (nb == CCN_FETCH_READ_TIMEOUT) {
01141                     perror("read failed, timeout");
01142                     exit(1);
01143                 }
01144                 char temp[256];
01145                 snprintf(temp, sizeof(temp), "ccn_fetch_read failed: %d", nb);
01146                 perror(temp);
01147                 return -1;
01148             }
01149         }
01150         ccn_fetch_close(fs);
01151     }
01152     
01153     gettimeofday(&parms->stopTime, 0);
01154     
01155     if (file != NULL)
01156     fclose(file);
01157     
01158     ccn_fetch_destroy(cf);
01159     
01160     ccn_destroy(&ccn);
01161     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb);
01162     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&nm);
01163     
01164     formatStats(parms);
01165     
01166     if (res > 0) res = 0;
01167     return res;
01168 }
01169 
01170 static int
01171 putFile(struct SyncTestParms *parms, char *src, char *dst) {
01172     // stores the src file to the dst file (in the repo)
01173     
01174     struct stat myStat;
01175     int res = stat(src, &myStat);
01176     if (res < 0) {
01177         perror("putFile, stat failed");
01178         return -1;
01179     }
01180     off_t fSize = myStat.st_size;
01181     
01182     if (fSize == 0) {
01183         return noteErr("putFile, stat failed, empty src");
01184     }
01185     FILE *file = fopen(src, "r");
01186     if (file == NULL) {
01187         perror("putFile, fopen failed");
01188         return -1;
01189     }
01190     
01191     struct ccn *ccn = NULL;
01192     ccn = ccn_create();
01193     if (ccn_connect(ccn, NULL) == -1) {
01194         return noteErr("putFile, could not connect to ccnd");
01195     }
01196     struct ccn_charbuf *cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
01197     struct ccn_charbuf *nm = ccn_charbuf_create();
01198     struct ccn_charbuf *cmd = ccn_charbuf_create();
01199     int bs = parms->blockSize;
01200     
01201     res = ccn_name_from_uri(nm, dst);
01202     if (res < 0) {
01203         return noteErr("putFile, ccn_name_from_uri failed");
01204     }
01205     ccn_create_version(ccn, nm, CCN_V_NOW, 0, 0);
01206     
01207     struct storeFileStruct *sfData = NEW_STRUCT(1, storeFileStruct);
01208     sfData->parms = parms;
01209     sfData->file = file;
01210     sfData->bs = bs;
01211     sfData->nm = nm;
01212     sfData->cb = cb;
01213     sfData->ccn = ccn;
01214     sfData->fSize = fSize;
01215     sfData->nSegs = (fSize + bs -1) / bs;
01216     sfData->segData = NEW_ANY(sfData->nSegs, unsigned char);
01217     
01218     {
01219         // make a template to govern the timestamp for the segments
01220         // this allows duplicate segment requests to return the same hash
01221         const unsigned char *vp = NULL;
01222         ssize_t vs;
01223         SyncGetComponentPtr(nm, SyncComponentCount(nm)-1, &vp, &vs);
01224         if (vp != NULL && vs > 0) {
01225             sfData->template = ccn_charbuf_create();
01226             ccnb_element_begin(sfData->template, CCN_DTAG_SignedInfo);
01227             ccnb_append_tagged_blob(sfData->template, CCN_DTAG_Timestamp, vp, vs);
01228             ccnb_element_end(sfData->template);
01229         } else return noteErr("putFile, create store template failed");
01230     }
01231     
01232     struct ccn_charbuf *template = SyncGenInterest(NULL,
01233                                                    parms->scope,
01234                                                    parms->life,
01235                                                    -1, -1, NULL);
01236     struct ccn_closure *action = NEW_STRUCT(1, ccn_closure);
01237     action->p = storeHandler;
01238     action->data = sfData;
01239     
01240     parms->fSize = fSize;
01241     
01242     // fire off a listener
01243     res = ccn_set_interest_filter(ccn, nm, action);
01244     if (res < 0) {
01245         return noteErr("putFile, ccn_set_interest_filter failed");
01246     }
01247     res = ccn_run(ccn, 40);
01248     if (res < 0) {
01249         return noteErr("putFile, ccn_run failed");
01250     }
01251     // initiate the write
01252     // construct the store request and "send" it as an interest
01253     ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(cmd, nm);
01254     ccn_name_from_uri(cmd, "%C1.R.sw");
01255     ccn_name_append_nonce(cmd);
01256     
01257     if (parms->verbose && parms->mode != 0) {
01258         struct ccn_charbuf *uri = SyncUriForName(nm);
01259         if (parms->mark) putMark(stdout);
01260         fprintf(stdout, "put init, %s\n",
01261                 ccn_charbuf_as_string(uri));
01262         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&uri);
01263     }
01264     gettimeofday(&parms->startTime, 0);
01265     ccn_get(ccn, cmd, template, DEFAULT_CMD_TIMEOUT, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0);
01266     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&template);
01267     if (res < 0) {
01268         return noteErr("putFile, ccn_get failed");
01269     }
01270     
01271     // wait for completion
01272     res = 0;
01273     while (res == 0 && sfData->stored < sfData->nSegs) {
01274         res = ccn_run(ccn, 2);
01275     }
01276     if (res < 0) {
01277         return noteErr("putFile, ccn_run failed while storing");
01278     }
01279     
01280     gettimeofday(&parms->stopTime, 0);
01281     
01282     res = ccn_set_interest_filter(ccn, nm, NULL);
01283     if (res < 0) {
01284         return noteErr("putFile, ccn_set_interest_filter failed (removal)");
01285     }
01286     res = ccn_run(ccn, 40);
01287     if (res < 0) {
01288         return noteErr("putFile, ccn_run failed");
01289     }
01290     
01291     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&sfData->template);
01292     free(sfData->segData);
01293     free(sfData);
01294     ccn_destroy(&ccn);
01295     fclose(file);
01296     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb);
01297     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cmd);
01298     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&nm);
01299     
01300     formatStats(parms);
01301     
01302     if (res > 0) res = 0;
01303     return res;
01304 }
01305 
01306 extern int
01307 appendComponents(struct ccn_charbuf *dst,
01308                  const struct ccn_charbuf *src,
01309                  int start, int len) {
01310     struct ccn_buf_decoder sbd;
01311     struct ccn_buf_decoder *s = SyncInitDecoderFromCharbuf(&sbd, src, 0);
01312     int count = 0;
01313     int pos = 0;
01314     if (!ccn_buf_match_dtag(s, CCN_DTAG_Name))
01315         // src is not a name
01316         return -__LINE__;
01317     ccn_buf_advance(s);
01318     int lim = start + len;
01319     while (count < lim) {
01320         if (!ccn_buf_match_dtag(s, CCN_DTAG_Component)) {
01321             ccn_buf_check_close(s);
01322             if (SyncCheckDecodeErr(s)) return -__LINE__;
01323             break;
01324         }
01325         ccn_buf_advance(s);
01326         const unsigned char *cPtr = NULL;
01327         size_t cSize = 0;
01328         if (ccn_buf_match_blob(s, &cPtr, &cSize)) ccn_buf_advance(s);
01329         if (cPtr == NULL)
01330             return -__LINE__;
01331         if (count >= start) {
01332             if (ccn_name_append(dst, cPtr, cSize) < 0)
01333                 return -__LINE__;
01334         }
01335         count++;
01336         ccn_buf_check_close(s);
01337         if (SyncCheckDecodeErr(s)) return -__LINE__;
01338         pos++;
01339     }
01340     return count;
01341 }
01342 
01343 static int
01344 putFileList(struct SyncTestParms *parms, char *listName) {
01345     struct ccn *ccn = NULL;
01346     ccn = ccn_create();
01347     if (ccn_connect(ccn, NULL) == -1) {
01348         return noteErr("putFile, could not connect to ccnd");
01349     }
01350     FILE *listFile = fopen(listName, "r");
01351     if (listFile == NULL) {
01352         return noteErr("putFileList, failed to open list file");
01353     }
01354     int ret = 0;
01355     struct SyncNameAccum *na = readAndAccumNames(listFile, MAX_READ_LEN);
01356     int i = 0;
01357     fclose(listFile);
01358     struct ccn_charbuf *tmp = ccn_charbuf_create();
01359     struct ccn_charbuf *template = SyncGenInterest(NULL,
01360                                                    parms->scope,
01361                                                    parms->life,
01362                                                    -1, -1, NULL);
01363     while (i < na->len) {
01364         tmp->length = 0;
01365         ccn_name_init(tmp);
01366         struct ccn_charbuf *each = na->ents[i].name;
01367         int nc = SyncComponentCount(each);
01368         if (parms->verbose) {
01369             struct ccn_charbuf *uri = SyncUriForName(each);
01370             if (parms->mark) putMark(stdout);
01371             fprintf(stdout, "putFileList %d, %s\n",
01372                     i, ccn_charbuf_as_string(uri));
01373             fflush(stdout);
01374             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&uri);
01375         }
01376         if (nc < 3) {
01377             ret = noteErr("putFileList, bad name");
01378             break;
01379         }
01380         const unsigned char *xp = NULL;
01381         ssize_t xs = -1;
01382         SyncGetComponentPtr(each, nc-2, &xp, &xs);
01383         if (xs > 0 && xp[0] == '\000') {
01384             // segment info, so split the name
01385             ret |= appendComponents(tmp, each, 0, nc-2);
01386             ret |= ccn_name_append_str(tmp, "\xC1.R.sw-c");
01387             ret |= ccn_name_append_nonce(tmp);
01388             ret |= appendComponents(tmp, each, nc-2, 2);
01389         } else {
01390             // no segment, so use the whole name
01391             ret |= appendComponents(tmp, each, 0, nc);
01392             ret |= ccn_name_append_str(tmp, "\xC1.R.sw-c");
01393             ret |= ccn_name_append_nonce(tmp);
01394         }
01395         
01396         if (ret < 0) {
01397             ret = noteErr("putFileList, bad name");
01398             break;
01399         }
01400         ccn_get(ccn, tmp, template, DEFAULT_CMD_TIMEOUT, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0);
01401         ret = ccn_run(ccn, 10);
01402         if (ret < 0) {
01403             ret = noteErr("putFileList, ccn_run failed");
01404             break;
01405         }
01406         i++;
01407     }
01408     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&template);
01409     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&tmp);
01410     na = SyncFreeNameAccumAndNames(na);
01411     ccn_destroy(&ccn);
01412     return ret;
01413 }
01414 
01415 static int
01416 existingRootOp(struct SyncTestParms *parms,
01417                char *topo, char *prefix,
01418                int delete) {
01419     // constructs a simple config slice and sends it to an attached repo
01420     // now we have the encoding, so make the hash
01421     struct ccn *ccn = NULL;
01422     int res = 0;
01423     
01424     ccn = ccn_create();
01425     if (ccn_connect(ccn, NULL) == -1) {
01426         perror("Could not connect to ccnd");
01427         exit(1);
01428     }
01429     
01430     // form the Sync protocol name
01431     static char *cmdLit = "\xC1.S.rs";
01432     struct ccn_charbuf *nm = ccn_charbuf_create();
01433     if (delete) cmdLit = "\xC1.S.cs";
01434     
01435     res |= ccn_name_init(nm);
01436     res |= ccn_name_from_uri(nm, topo);
01437     if (prefix != NULL) {
01438         struct ccn_charbuf *pre = ccn_charbuf_create();
01439         res |= ccn_name_from_uri(pre, prefix);
01440         res |= ccn_name_append_str(nm, cmdLit);
01441         res |= SyncAppendAllComponents(nm, pre);
01442         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&pre);
01443     }
01444     
01445     struct ccn_charbuf *cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
01446     if (delete) {
01447         // requesting deletion
01448         res |= localStore(parms, ccn, nm, NULL);
01449         if (res < 0) {
01450             res = noteErr("requestDelete, failed");
01451         } else {
01452             // claimed success 
01453             struct ccn_charbuf *uri = SyncUriForName(nm);
01454             if (parms->mark) putMark(stdout);
01455             fprintf(stdout, "requestDelete, sent %s\n",
01456                     ccn_charbuf_as_string(uri));
01457             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&uri);
01458         }
01459     } else {
01460         // requesting stats
01461         struct ccn_charbuf *tmpl = SyncGenInterest(NULL, 1, 2, -1, 1, NULL);
01462         res |= ccn_get(ccn, nm, tmpl, DEFAULT_CMD_TIMEOUT, cb, NULL, NULL, 0);
01463         
01464         const unsigned char *xp = NULL;
01465         size_t xs = 0;
01466         if (res < 0) {
01467             res = noteErr("requestStats, ccn_get failed");
01468         } else {
01469             res |= SyncPointerToContent(cb, NULL, &xp, &xs);
01470             
01471             if (res < 0 || xs == 0) {
01472                 res = noteErr("requestStats, failed");
01473             } else {
01474                 if (parms->mark) putMark(stdout);
01475                 fwrite(xp, xs, sizeof(char), stdout);
01476                 fprintf(stdout, "\n");
01477             }
01478         }
01479         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&tmpl);
01480     }
01481     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb);
01482     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&nm);
01483     ccn_destroy(&ccn);
01484     if (res > 0) res = 0;
01485     return res;
01486 }
01487 
01488 static void
01489 my_r_sync_msg(struct sync_plumbing *sd, const char *fmt, ...) {
01490     if (sd != NULL && fmt != NULL) {
01491         va_list ap;
01492         va_start(ap, fmt);
01493         vfprintf(stdout, fmt, ap);
01494         va_end(ap);
01495     }
01496 }
01497 
01498 struct sync_plumbing_client_methods client_methods = {
01499     &my_r_sync_msg,
01500     NULL,
01501     NULL,
01502     NULL,
01503     NULL
01504 };
01505 
01506 static void
01507 SyncFreeBase(struct SyncBaseStruct *base) {
01508     struct sync_plumbing *sd = base->sd;
01509     struct ccn_charbuf *state_buf = ccn_charbuf_create();
01510     sd->sync_methods->sync_stop(sd, state_buf);
01511     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&state_buf);
01512 }
01513 
01514 // TBD: make this NOT cloned, but also not taken from ccnr!
01515 int
01516 ccnr_msg_level_from_string(const char *s)
01517 {
01518     long v;
01519     char *ep;
01520     
01521     if (s == NULL || s[0] == 0)
01522         return(1);
01523     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "NONE"))
01524         return(CCNL_NONE);
01525     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "SEVERE"))
01526         return(CCNL_SEVERE);
01527     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "ERROR"))
01528         return(CCNL_ERROR);
01529     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "WARNING"))
01530         return(CCNL_WARNING);
01531     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "INFO"))
01532         return(CCNL_INFO);
01533     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "FINE"))
01534         return(CCNL_FINE);
01535     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "FINER"))
01536         return(CCNL_FINER);
01537     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "FINEST"))
01538         return(CCNL_FINEST);
01539     v = strtol(s, &ep, 10);
01540     if (v > CCNL_FINEST || v < 0 || ep[0] != 0)
01541         return(-1);
01542     return(v);
01543 }
01544 
01545 int
01546 main(int argc, char **argv) {
01547     int i = 1;
01548     int seen = 0;
01549     int res = 0;
01550     struct sync_plumbing sdStruct;
01551     struct sync_plumbing *sd = &sdStruct;
01552     struct SyncTestParms parmStore;
01553     struct SyncTestParms *parms = &parmStore;
01554     
01555     sd->client_methods = &client_methods;
01556     struct SyncBaseStruct *base = SyncNewBase(sd);
01557     
01558     memset(parms, 0, sizeof(parmStore));
01559     
01560     parms->mode = 1;
01561     parms->scope = 1;
01562     parms->syncScope = 2;
01563     parms->life = 4;
01564     parms->bufs = 4;
01565     parms->blockSize = 4096;
01566     parms->base = base;
01567     parms->resolve = 1;
01568     parms->segmented = 1;
01569     
01570     while (i < argc && res >= 0) {
01571         char * sw = argv[i];
01572         i++;
01573         char *arg1 = NULL;
01574         char *arg2 = NULL;
01575         if (i < argc) arg1 = argv[i];
01576         if (i+1 < argc) arg2 = argv[i+1];
01577         if (strcasecmp(sw, "-debug") == 0 || strcasecmp(sw, "-d") == 0) {
01578             i++;
01579             base->debug = ccnr_msg_level_from_string(arg1);
01580             if (base->debug < 0) {
01581                 res = noteErr("invalid debug level %s", arg1);
01582             }
01583         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-v") == 0) {
01584             parms->verbose = 1;
01585         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-cat2") == 0) {
01586             parms->mode = 3;
01587         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-mark") == 0) {
01588             parms->mark = 1;
01589         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-digest") == 0) {
01590             parms->digest = 1;
01591         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-null") == 0) {
01592             parms->mode = 0;
01593         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-binary") == 0) {
01594             parms->mode = 1;
01595         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-ccnb") == 0) {
01596             parms->mode = 1;
01597         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-text") == 0) {
01598             parms->mode = 2;
01599         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-nodup") == 0) {
01600             parms->noDup = 1;
01601         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-nores") == 0) {
01602             parms->resolve = 0;
01603         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-noseg") == 0) {
01604             parms->segmented = 0;
01605         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-nosend") == 0) {
01606             parms->noSend = 1;
01607         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-bs") == 0) {
01608             i++;
01609             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01610                 int bs = atoi(arg1);
01611                 if (bs <= 0 || bs > 64*1024) {
01612                     res = noteErr("invalid block size %s", arg1);
01613                 }
01614                 parms->blockSize = bs;
01615             } else
01616             res = noteErr("missing block size");
01617             seen++;
01618         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-bufs") == 0) {
01619             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01620                 i++;
01621                 int bufs = atoi(arg1);
01622                 if (bufs <= 0 || bufs > 1024) {
01623                     res = noteErr("invalid number of buffers %s", arg1);
01624                     break;
01625                 }
01626                 parms->bufs = bufs;
01627             } else 
01628             res = noteErr("missing number of buffers");
01629         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-scope") == 0) {
01630             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01631                 int scope = atoi(arg1);
01632                 if (scope < -1 || scope > 2) {
01633                     res = noteErr("invalid scope %s", arg1);
01634                     break;
01635                 }
01636                 parms->scope = scope;
01637                 i++;
01638             } else
01639                 res = noteErr("missing scope");
01640             seen++;
01641         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-syncScope") == 0) {
01642             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01643                 int scope = atoi(arg1);
01644                 if (scope < -1 || scope > 2) {
01645                     res = noteErr("invalid scope %s", arg1);
01646                     break;
01647                 }
01648                 parms->syncScope = scope;
01649                 i++;
01650             } else
01651                 res = noteErr("missing scope");
01652             seen++;
01653         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-life") == 0) {
01654             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01655                 int life = atoi(arg1);
01656                 if (life < -1 || life > 30) {
01657                     res = noteErr("invalid interest lifetime %s", arg1);
01658                     break;
01659                 }
01660                 parms->life = life;
01661                 i++;
01662             } else
01663             res = noteErr("missing interest lifetime");
01664             seen++;
01665         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-basic") == 0) {
01666             res = testRootBasic(parms);
01667             seen++;
01668         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-target") == 0) {
01669             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01670                 parms->target = arg1;
01671                 i++;
01672             } else
01673             res = noteErr("missing target");
01674             seen++;
01675         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-build") == 0) {
01676             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01677                 i++;
01678                 parms->inputName = arg1;
01679                 res = testReadBuilder(parms);
01680             } else
01681             res = noteErr("missing file name");
01682             seen++;
01683         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-read") == 0) {
01684             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01685                 i++;
01686                 parms->inputName = arg1;
01687                 parms->sort = 0;
01688                 res = testReader(parms);
01689             } else
01690             res = noteErr("missing file name");
01691             seen++;
01692         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-sort") == 0) {
01693             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01694                 i++;
01695                 parms->inputName = arg1;
01696                 parms->sort = 1;
01697                 res = testReader(parms);
01698             } else
01699             res = noteErr("missing file name");
01700             seen++;
01701         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-abs") == 0) {
01702             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01703                 i++;
01704                 parms->inputName = arg1;
01705                 parms->sort = 2;
01706                 res = testReader(parms);
01707             } else
01708             res = noteErr("missing file name");
01709             seen++;
01710         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-splits") == 0) {
01711             int n = 0;
01712             while (i >= argc) {
01713                 char *x = argv[i];
01714                 char c = x[0];
01715                 if (c < '0' || c > '9') break;
01716                 n++;
01717                 i++;
01718             }
01719             parms->nSplits = n;
01720             if (parms->splits != NULL) free(parms->splits);
01721             parms->splits = NULL;
01722             if (n > 0) {
01723                 int j = 0;
01724                 parms->splits = NEW_ANY(n, int);
01725                 i = i - n;
01726                 while (j < n) {
01727                     parms->splits[j] = atoi(argv[i]);
01728                     i++;
01729                     j++;
01730                 }
01731             }
01732             seen++;
01733         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-encode") == 0) {
01734             res = testEncodeDecode(parms);
01735             seen++;
01736         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-slice") == 0) {
01737             char **clauses = NEW_ANY(argc, char *);
01738             int count = 0;
01739             if (arg1 != NULL && arg2 != NULL) {
01740                 i++;
01741                 i++;
01742                 while (i < argc) {
01743                     char *clause = argv[i];
01744                     if (clause[0] == '-' || clause[0] == 0) break;
01745                     i++;
01746                     clauses[count] = clause;
01747                     count++;
01748                 }
01749                 res = sendSlice(parms, arg1, arg2, count, clauses);
01750             } else
01751             res = noteErr("missing slice topo or prefix");
01752             seen++;
01753         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-get") == 0) {
01754             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01755                 i++;
01756                 if (arg2 != NULL) {
01757                     // dst is optional, elide if it looks like a switch
01758                     if (arg2[0] != '-') i++;
01759                     else arg2 = NULL;
01760                 }
01761                 res = getFile(parms, arg1, arg2);
01762             } else {
01763                 res = noteErr("missing src file");
01764             }
01765             seen++;
01766         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-put") == 0) {
01767             if (arg1 == NULL) {
01768                 res = noteErr("missing src file");
01769             } else if (arg2 == NULL) {
01770                 res = noteErr("missing dst file");
01771             } else {
01772                 i++;
01773                 i++;
01774                 res = putFile(parms, arg1, arg2);
01775             }
01776             seen++;
01777         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-putList") == 0) {
01778             if (arg1 == NULL) {
01779                 res = noteErr("missing list file");
01780             } else {
01781                 i++;
01782                 i++;
01783                 res = putFileList(parms, arg1);
01784             }
01785             seen++;
01786         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-stats") == 0) {
01787             if (arg1 != NULL && arg2 != NULL) {
01788                 i++;
01789                 i++;
01790                 res = existingRootOp(parms, arg1, arg2, 0);
01791             } else
01792             res = noteErr("missing topo or hash");
01793             seen++;
01794         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-delete") == 0) {
01795             if (arg1 != NULL && arg2 != NULL) {
01796                 i++;
01797                 i++;
01798                 res = existingRootOp(parms, arg1, arg2, 1);
01799             } else
01800             res = noteErr("missing topo or hash");
01801             seen++;
01802                 } else {
01803             // can't understand this sw
01804             noteErr("invalid switch: %s", sw);
01805             seen = 0;
01806             break;
01807         }
01808     }
01809     if (parms->splits != NULL) free(parms->splits);
01810     if (parms->root != NULL) SyncRemRoot(parms->root);
01811     SyncFreeBase(base);
01812     if (seen == 0 && res >= 0) {
01813         printf("usage: \n");
01814         printf("    -debug S        set debug level {NONE, SEVERE, ERROR, WARNING, INFO, FINE, FINER, FINEST}\n");
01815         printf("    -v              verbose\n");
01816         printf("    -null           no output\n");
01817         printf("    -ccnb           use binary output\n");
01818         printf("    -binary         use binary output\n");
01819         printf("    -text           use text output\n");
01820         printf("    -cat2           use ccncatchunks2 format\n");
01821         printf("    -mark           print a time code prefix\n");
01822         printf("    -digest         show the digest when doing a put\n");
01823         printf("    -nodup          disallow duplicate segment requests for -put\n");
01824         printf("    -nores          avoid resolve version\n");
01825         printf("    -noseg          no segments\n");
01826         printf("    -nosend         no send of the slice\n");
01827         printf("    -scope N        scope=N for repo commands (default 1)\n");
01828         printf("    -life N         life=N for interests (default 4)\n");
01829         printf("    -bs N           set block size for put (default 4096)\n");
01830         printf("    -bufs N         number of buffers for get (default 4)\n");
01831         printf("    -basic          some very basic tests\n");
01832         printf("    -read F         read names from file F\n");
01833         printf("    -sort F         read names from file F, sort them\n");
01834         printf("    -encode         simple encode/decode test\n");
01835         printf("    -build F        build tree from file F\n");
01836         printf("    -get src [dst]  src is uri in repo, dst is file name (optional)\n");
01837         printf("    -put src dst    src is file name, dst is uri in repo\n");
01838         printf("    -putList L      does checked write of each name, L is file name of name list\n");
01839         printf("    -slice T P C*   topo, prefix, clause ... (send slice to repo)\n");
01840         printf("    -delete T H     delete root with topo T, hash H from the repo\n");
01841         printf("    -stats T H      print statistics for root with topo T, hash H\n");
